# Does your screen freeze during normal use?
# Does your screen freeze when using the <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-intel/+bug/359392/comments/78 | test script]]</nowiki>? (you will need wmctrl installed)
# What size is your screen(s) in pixels? Command: xdpyinfo | awk '/dimensions:/{print$2}'
# How much memory do you have? Command: free -m | awk '/Mem:/{print$2"M"}'
# What specific 965 model do you have? Command: lspci -vvnn | grep -A2 "VGA "
# Are you running with debug symbols? Detailed instructions: DebuggingSystemCrash and DebuggingProgramCrash
# Which type of Ubuntu are you running (32-bit or 64-bit)? Command: uname -m
# Does your screen freeze while running the Jaunty live-cd?
# If you can reproduce the problem, please check if you can still reproduce it with version 2.6.3-0ubuntu9pitti4 from <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~pitti/+archive/ppa|Martin Pitt's PPA]]</nowiki>. That version removes a patch which was meant to prevent a problem on the i945, but the patch never worked very well.
